member.name: T:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig
member.summary: Used to configure a .
member.remarks:
Used to configure a `IAuthenticator` used for acquiring access tokens. The TAX system can create this configuration behind the scene if you describe your application using the more simplified when invoking
but an `AuthConfig` allows for more custom configuration.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.IsRequestingUserId
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether user identity will be requested during the auth flow.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the to the authority endpoint.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.TokenIssuer
member.summary: Gets or sets the to the token issuing endpoint.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.RedirectUri
member.summary: Gets or sets a redirect , used for passing back an auth code.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.ClientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the client id (a.k.a. "app id").

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets a scope value when applicable.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.IsStateUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use state in the auth code flow.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.IsPkceUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the PKCE extension with the auth code flow.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.IsCaching
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying whether authorizations (tokens) should be cached. Default value is true.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthConfig.TokenCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a (custom) token cache. This value cannot be unassigned and a default token cache will always be provided.

member.param: The targeted runtime environment.
The application's client id (a.k.a. "app id").
The application's redirect .

(optional; default = )
An intended runtime platform.
member.returns: A object with a default configuration for the specified application.

member.summary: Creates a default OAuth configuration for a specified application.
member.param: Describes the application to be authorized.
member.returns: A object with a default configuration for the specified application.

member.summary: Flags the authorization request to also request user identity. This is often required by APIs when making requests for data.
member.remarks: This is mainly a clear-code way to ask for the "openid" scope.

member.name: T:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument
member.summary: A discovery document obtained from a well-known OIDC endpoint.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.Current
member.summary: Gets the cached , if available.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.LastUpdated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating when the document was last updated from the discovery endpoint. The time is given as UTC.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.Issuer
member.summary: Get the token issuer host base URL.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.AuthorizationEndpoint
member.summary: Endpoint that validates all authorization requests.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.TokenEndpoint
member.summary: URL of the token endpoint. After a client has received an authorization code, that code is presented to the token endpoint and exchanged for an identity token, an access token, and a refresh token.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.UserInformationEndpoint
member.summary: URL of the user information endpoint.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.JwksUri
member.summary: URL of the JSON Web Key Set. This set is a collection of JSON Web Keys, a standard method for representing cryptographic keys in a JSON structure. For Hosted Login, that collection consists of the public keys used to verify the signatures of the identity tokens issued by the authorization server.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.ResponseTypesSupported
member.summary: Specifies the way the authorization server responds after a user successfully authenticates.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.SubjectTypesSupported
member.summary: JSON array containing a list of the supported Subject Identifier types.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.ScopesSupported
member.summary: JSON array containing a list of the scopes that the authorization server supports.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.GrantTypesSupported
member.summary: Specifies the different ways that a client can be granted an access token and, as a result, can be given access to specific resources.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.IdTokenSigningAlgValuesSupported
member.summary: JSON array consisting of all the JSON Web Signature algorithms that can be used for signing JSON Web Tokens, such as SHA1 or SHA256.

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.DownloadAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads and returns the found at a Url resolved from the specified .
member.param: Either a URL for the well-known discovery endpoint or a (serialized) JWT token to be used for resolving the URL.
(optional; default = false) Specifies whether to use the (cached) value or download a new document and set it as the one.
(optional; default = false) Specifies whether to cache the downloaded upon success.
member.returns: Please note that when there is a document already, passing a false value will have the method simply return the one if assigned or, automatically, download a new one and then set that as the document.

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryDocument.TryLoadCached
member.summary: Attempts loading a discovery document from the cache and returns a value to indicate the outcome.

The policy.
member.returns: true if [is secure scheme] [the specified URL]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy
member.summary: Security policy for retrieving a discovery document

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the Authority on which the policy checks will be based on

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.AuthorityValidationStrategy
member.summary: Strategy used to validate issuer name and endpoints based on expected authority. Defaults to .

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.RequireHttps
member.summary: Specifies if HTTPS is enforced on all endpoints. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.AllowHttpOnLoopback
member.summary: Specifies if HTTP is allowed on loopback addresses. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.ValidateIssuerName
member.summary: Specifies if the issuer name is checked to be identical to the authority. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.ValidateEndpoints
member.summary: Specifies if all endpoints are checked to belong to the authority. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.EndpointValidationExcludeList
member.summary: Specifies a list of endpoints that should be excluded from validation

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.AdditionalEndpointBaseAddresses
member.summary: Specifies a list of additional base addresses that should be allowed for endpoints

member.name: P:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.oidc.DiscoveryPolicy.RequireKeySet
member.summary: Specifies if a key set is required. Defaults to true.

member.name: T:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache
member.summary: A basic token cache that stores instances of .

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache.AddAsync(System.String,TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.AuthResult,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Adds tokens (in an object) to the cache.
member.param: Identifies the tokens (typically a client/app id).
An object containing the tokens.
(optional; default = false) When set, an existing item will be replaced. When unset, and an item is already associated with the , an is thrown.

(optional)
A time when the tokens expire. Please note that governs expiration of the access token themselves. This value simply controls how long the result is being cached. Leave unassigned unless all tokens should expire at the same time.

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache.TryGetAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts fetching all tokens from the cache.
member.param: Identifies the tokens (typically a client/app id).
member.returns: An item.

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache.RemoveAccessTokenAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes any access token from cache.
member.param: Identifies the token (typically a client/app id).

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache.RemoveRefreshTokenAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes any refresh token from cache.
member.param: Identifies the token (typically a client/app id).

member.name: M:TetraPak.Auth.Xamarin.TokenCache.RemoveAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all tokens from cache.
member.param: Identifies the tokens (typically a client/app id).
